essential.title: Getting Started
essential.description: New to staking? Start here for the basics

what-is-staking.title: What is Staking?
what-is-staking.content:
Staking is a way to support the Polkadot network while potentially earning rewards. Think of it like investing in the network's security and operation, and getting a return for your participation.

ðŸš¨ **Important Commitment Notice** ðŸš¨

Before you start staking, know this: When you decide to unstake your DOT, there's a 28-day unbonding period. During these 28 days:

- Your tokens are locked and cannot be transferred
- You will **NOT** earn staking rewards
- The process **CANNOT** be reversed or sped up

pools-vs-nominating.title: Pools vs Nominating
pools-vs-nominating.content:
## What are Pools?

Pools are a low-barrier entry point to staking. Perfect for users with smaller amounts of DOT:

- You contribute your tokens to a shared pool
- Professional pool managers handle the technical details
- Lower minimum staking requirements
- Great for beginners who want to start staking with less risk and complexity

## What is Nominating?

A direct method of staking your tokens with more advanced features:

- You personally select and support validators
- Requires more technical knowledge
- Typically needs a larger minimum stake
- Gives you more control over which validators you support
- Potential for higher returns, but also higher complexity

## Should I Choose Pools or Nominating?

When deciding between pools and direct nomination, consider your experience level, DOT holdings, and desired level of involvement.

**Pools Are Best If:**

- You're new to staking
- Have a smaller amount of DOT
- Want a hands-off approach
- Prefer lower entry barriers
- Minimize technical complexity

**Nominating Is Best If:**

- You have a larger amount of DOT
- Understand validator selection
- Want more direct control
- Willing to manage your staking actively
- Comfortable with slightly more technical processes

**Key Differences**

| Feature           | Pools      | Nominating          |
|-------------------|------------|---------------------|
| Minimum Stake     | Low        | Higher              |
| Control           | Shared     | Direct              |
| Complexity        | Simple     | More Complex        |
| Potential Returns | Consistent | Potentially Higher  |

**Pro Tips**

- Start with pools if you're unsure
- You can always switch strategies later
- Never stake more than you can afford to lock up
- Diversify your staking approach

## Why Staking Matters

- Supports network security
- Provides potential passive income
- Democratizes blockchain participation
- Helps decentralize the Polkadot ecosystem

## Advanced Considerations

- Understand slashing risks
- Regularly review your staking strategy
- Keep learning about network dynamics
- Stay informed about validator performance

first-stake.title: Making Your First Stake
first-stake.content:
Ready to start staking? Here's how in simple steps:

- Ensure you have DOT tokens in your account
- Choose between direct staking or joining a pool
- If direct staking, select your validators
- Bond your tokens
- Start earning rewards

rewards.title: Understanding Rewards
rewards.content:
Learn how staking rewards work. Rewards are paid out every 24 hours (one era) based on network performance. The amount you earn depends on:

- How much DOT you've staked
- Which validators you've chosen
- Overall network conditions

nomination-pools.title: Nomination Pools Explained
nomination-pools.content:
Nomination pools let you combine your DOT with other stakers. This is great for smaller holders as you can:

- Start staking with less DOT
- Share the costs of running a validator
- Still earn proportional rewards

validator-selection.title: Choosing Validators
validator-selection.content:
Learn how to pick reliable validators. Good validators typically have:

- High uptime and reliability
- Reasonable commission rates
- Good track record
- Sufficient self-stake

controller-accounts.title: Controller Accounts
controller-accounts.content:
Controller accounts add security to your staking setup. They:

- Keep your main (stash) account safe
- Handle routine staking operations
- Manage your nominations
- Process rewards

slashing.title: Understanding Slashing
slashing.content:
Slashing is a penalty for validator misbehavior. To protect yourself:

- Choose reliable validators
- Diversify your nominations
- Monitor validator performance
- Stay informed about network changes

nominate.automaticallyBonded: Automatically bond payouts to your existing staked balance.
nominate.controllerNotImported: You have not imported your controller account. If you have lost access to your controller account, set a new one now. Otherwise, import the controller into one of your active extensions.
nominate.fullCommissionValidatorSubtitle: You will not receive staking rewards from validators who charge 100% commission. Consider updating your nominations.
nominate.fullCommissionValidatorTitle: You Have a Nomination with 100% Commission
nominate.payoutDestinationSubtitle: Choose how payouts will be received. Payouts can either be compounded or sent to an account as free balance.
nominate.poolDestroy: Pool is being destroyed and nominating is no longer possible.
nominate.readOnly: Your account is read only, and cannot sign transactions.
nominate.unstakePromptInQueue: You are in the fast unstake queue. You will not be able to carry out any nominator tasks while you are registered for fast unstake.
nominate.unstakePromptReadyToWithdraw: Your bonded funds are now unlocked and ready to withdraw.
nominate.unstakePromptRevert: If you no longer wish to unstake, rebond your {{unit}} and start nominating again.
nominate.unstakePromptWaitingForUnlocks: Waiting for unlocks to become available to withdraw.

overview.bondedInPools: The total {{networkUnit}} currently bonded in nomination pools.
overview.networkCurrentlyStakedSubtitle: The total {{unit}} currently being staked amongst all validators and nominators.
overview.poolMembersBonding: pool members are actively bonding in pools.
overview.totalNumAccounts: The total number of accounts that have joined a pool.

pools.assignedToAnyAccount: Your Root, Nominator and Bouncer roles can be assigned to any account.
pools.availableToClaim: The outstanding amount of {{unit}} available to claim by pool members.
pools.beenClaimedBy: The total amount of {{unit}} that has been claimed by pool members.
pools.closePool: You can now withdraw and close the pool.
pools.joinPoolHeading: Join {{totalMembers}} pool members staking a total of {{totalPoolPoints}} {{unit}} on {{network}}.
pools.leftThePool: All members have now left the pool
pools.permissionToUnbond: You have permission to unbond and withdraw funds of any pool member. Use a member's menu
pools.poolCreator: As the pool creator, you will consume your pool's Depositor role.
pools.poolNameSupport: Pool names support characters, symbols and emojis - be creative!
pools.readOnly: Your account is read only, and cannot sign transactions.
pools.stopNominating: To continue with pool closure, stop nominating.
pools.unbondYourFunds: You can now unbond your funds.
pools.withdrawUnlock: Withdraw your unlock chunk to proceed with pool closure.
